ingredients.unit: as needed for boiling pasta and sauce

instructions: Finely dice onion, carrot, and celery.
Blend or grate the tomato to create a smooth pulp.
Set all prepped ingredients aside for cooking.
tips: Smaller diced vegetables create a smoother, sweeter sauce.
Fresh tomato can be partly substituted with tomato sauce if unavailable.

instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Add spaghetti and cook until al dente following package instructions.
Reserve a small amount of pasta water if desired.
tips: Use about 1 tsp of salt in boiling water for well-seasoned pasta.
Stop boiling when pasta is slightly firm; it will finish in the sauce.

instructions: Heat vegetable oil and butter in a pot.
Add diced onion, carrot, and celery.
Sauté on medium-low until softened and fragrant.
tips: Slow cooking at medium-low heat brings out natural sweetness.

instructions: Add ground pork and stir-fry until no longer pink.
Pour in cooking wine, tomato pulp, seasoning mix, and tomato sauce.
Season with salt and black pepper.
Simmer until sauce thickens and flavors combine.
tips: Scrape fond (brown bits) for richer flavor.
Add a splash of pasta water if the sauce becomes too thick.

instructions: Drain cooked spaghetti and add to the sauce pot.
Toss until evenly coated and saucy.
Place cheese slice on top and melt briefly before serving.
tips: Mix over low heat for better absorption.
Serve immediately while hot and creamy.
